Key Match Events: Luka Doncic delivered 32 points, nine rebounds and seven assists in a dominant performance.
Doncic scored 14 points in the first quarter to help the Mavericks to a 30-22 lead.
Doncic scored 25 first-half points, including five three-pointers.
Dallas maintained their momentum in the second half and stretched their advantage to 82-52 on Doncic’s free throw with six minutes and five seconds to play in the third quarter.
Daniel Gafford scored a season-high 18 points for Dallas.
Kyrie Irving added 17 points and Dereck Lively II had 11 points and 11 rebounds.
Post-Match Reflections: Luka Doncic expressed that the game was 'real fun' and highlighted the team's defense, rebounding, and pace.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Orlando Magic made just eight of 41 three-point attempts and are currently without All-Star forward Paolo Banchero due to an abdominal muscle injury.
